HowToChooseSection.title: How to choose the best cloud storage for video files
HowToChooseSection.description: Finding cloud storage for video files can be challenging due to file upload restrictions, a lack of privacy, or budget.

descriptions:
Free cloud storage for video files may work for smaller files, but many free services come with restrictions, and additional features are behind a paywall. It's important to compare pricing and features and determine whether these plans meet your needs.

If you want cloud storage for large video files, Internxt offers secure cloud storage, VPN, Antivirus, Mail, and Meet in its plans. You can get started for free or from €3 per month for annual or lifetime plans, or store petabytes of videos with Internxt S3 object storage for €7/TB/month.

Secure cloud storage for video files is essential for individual, freelance, or company use, as without it, your content could be at risk. Videos containing sensitive, valuable, or proprietary content require extreme security measures to remain secure and private.

Choose a cloud storage provider that doesn't use AI to scan your content to train its models, and keep your content private by providers that use zero-knowledge encryption to ensure only you can view and access your files.

Storing a library of large video files can quickly use up your cloud storage, leaving you with limited space for new videos or forcing you to delete old files to make room for new projects, which may not be feasible.

Choose a cloud storage provider that allows you to scale your storage based on your needs. When you can easily upgrade your plan, you don't have to worry about migrating all your videos to another service, and you can keep your workflow uninterrupted.

answer: If you don't know how much cloud storage you need for your videos, for the average user, 200GB is usually enough.
Professionals working with higher resolutions, like 4K or 8K, will require a minimum of 1TB.
Businesses that need to host a large number of video files will benefit most from object storage, such as Internxt S3.

faq.question: What is zero-knowledge encryption, and how does it protect my videos?
answer: Zero-knowledge encryption means the encryption process and keys are managed on your device, so nobody can view, monitor, or access your files or video content.
This differs from encryption by Big Tech companies because they hold and manage the keys to your files, limiting the privacy of your cloud storage.
